meanings.sent1: She likes to embroider flowers on her pillowcases.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother taught me how to embroider a simple pattern.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to embroider its own version of a mouse on the fabric.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to embroider the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skilled hands seemed to magically embroider the canvas with life.

meanings.definition: To add embellishments or details to a story or account
meanings.sent1: The author tends to embroider his tales with colorful descriptions.
meanings.sent2: She always embroiders her anecdotes with exaggerated details.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to embroider the witness's statement with fictional elements.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to embroider a sense of mystery into the air.
meanings.sent5: The speaker's voice had the power to embroider even the simplest story into a captivating narrative.
